askChatGptButton.pleaseRunTheTestsFirst:
**Functional Purpose**: Explains why the 'Ask ChatGPT' button is disabled.
**UI Location**: Editor â†’ Ask ChatGPT button (tooltip)
**When Users See This**: When the user has not yet run tests on their code.
**Technical Context**: Standard text; no special formatting
**Current English**: "Please run the tests first."
askChatGptButton.pleaseRerunTheTestsToCo:
**Functional Purpose**: Explains why the 'Ask ChatGPT' button is disabled.
**UI Location**: Editor â†’ Ask ChatGPT button (tooltip)
**When Users See This**: When the user has made changes but not re-run tests since their last submission.
**Technical Context**: Standard text; no special formatting
**Current English**: "Please rerun the tests to continue."
askChatGptButton.testsAreCurrentlyRunnin:
**Functional Purpose**: Explains why the 'Ask ChatGPT' button is disabled.
**UI Location**: Editor â†’ Ask ChatGPT button (tooltip)
**When Users See This**: When the tests are currently in the process of running.
**Technical Context**: Standard text; no special formatting
**Current English**: "Tests are currently running."
askChatGptButton.awaitingResponseFromCha:
**Functional Purpose**: Explains why the 'Ask ChatGPT' button is disabled.
**UI Location**: Editor â†’ Ask ChatGPT button (tooltip)
**When Users See This**: When a request to ChatGPT has been made and is awaiting a response.
**Technical Context**: Standard text; no special formatting
**Current English**: "Awaiting response from ChatGPT. Please stand by."
askChatGptButton.congratsTheTestsArePass:
**Functional Purpose**: Explains why the 'Ask ChatGPT' button is disabled.
**UI Location**: Editor â†’ Ask ChatGPT button (tooltip)
**When Users See This**: When all tests are passing successfully.
**Technical Context**: Standard text; no special formatting
**Current English**: "Congrats! The tests are passing! ðŸŽ‰"
askChatGptButton.stuckAskChatGPT:
**Functional Purpose**: Label for a button that initiates a ChatGPT interaction.
**UI Location**: Editor â†’ Bottom panel (button text)
**When Users See This**: When the editor is displayed and the user is an insider.
**Technical Context**: Standard text; no special formatting
**Current English**: "Stuck? Ask ChatGPT"
resultsPanel.testRunCancelled:
**Functional Purpose**: Informs the user that the test run was cancelled.
**UI Location**: Editor â†’ Results Panel (toast message)
**When Users See This**: Immediately after a test run is explicitly cancelled by the user.
**Technical Context**: Appears as a toast notification. The icon is 'completed-check-circle'.
**Current English**: "Test run cancelled"
resultsPanel.wellRunYourCode:
**Functional Purpose**: Explains what happens when the user runs their code, indicating it will be evaluated against test cases.
**UI Location**: Editor â†’ Results Panel (paragraph text below prompt)
**When Users See This**: When the Results Panel is active and no tests have been run yet.
**Technical Context**: Standard text; no special formatting
**Current English**: "We'll run your code against a series of test cases. If it passes all of them, your solution is good to go!"
